meanings.definition: A plant of the legume family, typically with three round leaves and small white or pink flowers.
meanings.sent1: The field was filled with clovers swaying in the breeze.
meanings.sent2: I picked a handful of clovers to bring home.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun hid his pot of gold under the clovers.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like the dew on the clovers in the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The scent of clovers filled the air with sweetness.

meanings.definition: A symbol of good luck or prosperity.
meanings.sent1: Carrying a four-leaf clover is believed to bring good luck.
meanings.sent2: She kept a small clover charm in her pocket for prosperity.
meanings.sent3: Finding a clover with more than four leaves is considered extremely lucky.
meanings.sent4: The clover necklace she wore seemed to bring her good fortune.
meanings.sent5: The clovers in the garden seemed to dance with luck.

meanings.definition: A patch of land covered in clover plants.
meanings.sent1: The horses grazed peacefully in the clovers.
meanings.sent2: The meadow was a sea of green clovers.
meanings.sent3: The picnic blanket was spread out on a bed of clovers.
meanings.sent4: The clovers stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The children played hide-and-seek among the clovers.
